name: World Independence Days Quiz | Seasonal | 10 Questions

questions.text: When does the United States of America celebrate Independence Day?
questions.explanation:
July 4.

	On July 4, 1776, the final wording of the Declaration of Independence (from Great Britain) was approved by the Continental Congress, though it would take several years for war to settle the matter. Many thanks to player yorkshire_boy for clarifying that -- contrary to popular belief -- the document was likely not signed on the famous date, but rather a month or more later by various dignitaries!

questions.text: When is the national holiday in France?
questions.explanation:
July 14.

	Bastille Day (July 14) commemorates the day in 1789 when French revolutionaries, upset at the excesses of the monarchy, stormed the royal prison at the Bastille in Paris. This began the French Revolution.

questions.text: Which of these countries celebrates their independence on January 1?
questions.explanation:
Cameroon.

	On January 1, 1960, the French granted Cameroon its independence.

questions.text: When do the Philippines celebrate their independence?
questions.explanation:
June 12.

	On June 12, 1898, the Philippines declared their independence from Spain. They did not actually become independent until granted freedom by the United States on July 4, 1946.

questions.text: What Caribbean nation celebrates its independence on November 1?
When does Tanzania celebrate its independence day?

June 19.

	This commemorates the establishment of the monarchy in 1961, when the British treaty of 1899 expired. Kuwait's actual National Day is February 25, which is the anniversary of the coronation of Sheikh Abdullah.

questions.text: And when is the Laotian Independence Day?
questions.explanation:
July 19.

	Laos gained its independence from France in 1949.

questions.text: When does Nicaragua celebrate Independence Day?
questions.explanation:
September 15.

	This celebrates the day in 1821 when Central America declared its independence.

questions.text: And finally, when is New Zealand Day?
questions.explanation:
February 6.

	Also known as Waitangi Day, New Zealand Day celebrates the signing of the Waitangi Treaty in 1840, when the Maoris granted the British control of New Zealand.
